thread.title: Playbuzz release tricky new riddles to solve
thread.title_full: Playbuzz release tricky new riddles to solve | Daily Mail Online

author: Esra Gurkan For Mailonline
title: Playbuzz release tricky new riddles to solve
text:
I am very easy to get into, but it is hard to get out of me. What am I?
This is just one of fifteen infuriating riddles, posted by Playbuzz , that will be sure to leave you scratching your head.
Once the answers are revealed, you'll question why you struggled to figure them out in the first place.
Have a go and see how many you can get right - some are a lot harder than they look.
1.
This question might sound obvious the answer might just surprise you. How many months have 28 days?
2.
Two fathers and two sons walk into a candy store. They each buy something for 50p but they only spend 1 pound 50p. How is that possible?
3.
If you don't get this one right then it will leave you feeling frustrated. Railroad crossing without any cars. Can you spell that without any R's?
4.
This one is simple so can you get it right? What's brown and sticky? The answer is revealed below
5.
A truck driver is going opposite traffic on a one-way street. A police officer sees him but doesn't stop him. Why? (Ignore the spelling errors in the picture)
6.
This sounds like a tricky question but actually is very easy, so can you answer it? Which side of a cat has the most fur?
7.
I am very easy to get into but it is hard to get out of me. What am I? The answer is one-worded
8.
I cannot hear or even see, but sense light and sounds there may be. Sometimes I end up on the hook or even deep in a book. What am I?
9.
A King, Queen and two twins all lay in a large room. How on earth are there no adults in the room?
10.
When you don't know what I am then I am something. When you do know what I am then I am nothing. What am I? Can you work it out...
11.
What kind of room doesn't have any rooms or windows? The answer is easier than you think. Don't over complicate it
12.
It turns into a different story. What is it? Scroll down to see if you've got the right answer to the riddle
13.
This is one of life's biggest questions: Why don't mountains catch colds? See if you know why
14.
When do you go at red and stop at green? This doesn't sound like the traffic lights we're used to
15.
This last riddle posted to Playbuzz might just trip you up. Can you work out what it is that can drum?
